It occurs when someone experiences two or more contradictory ideas, thoughts, or beliefs at the same time. This can cause feelings of confusion, anxiety, and stress. The conflict can be caused by different beliefs, values, or behaviors, or by different information about the same topic. Cognitive dissonance can be resolved in several ways, including by changing one's beliefs, values, or behavior to better fit the other beliefs, values, or behaviors, or by reducing the importance of the conflicting ideas or beliefs. It is a common phenomenon and is often used to explain human behavior and decision-making. It is also a popular topic in psychology textbooks and research papers. The concept of cognitive dissonance has been used to explain a wide range of human behavior, including decision-
